results.title: Banjo's Australia
results.brief_description: This program explains A. B. Paterson’s contribution and significance to Australian literature from the 1890’s to the World War I. It traces Paterson’s personal history, his love of the bush, his admiration for camaraderie and spirit of the bush and the pathos and humour of bush life.

results.title: Beautiful lies: a film about Peter Carey
results.creator_credit: Don Featherstone, Australia Council and Australian Film Commission
results.brief_description: Peter Carey is one of Australia’s most talented writers. All four of his published works have won major literary awards. This film, takes a journey through his life and work and looks at the way he transforms his native country into a bizarre land of nightmares and surreal comedy. Throughout the film, an interview with Peter Carey is interwoven with lavish dramatisation. An intriguing and illuminating film about a remarkable writer.

results.title: Whereas the people
results.brief_description: Traces the development of the Australian Constitution and investigates its relevance for today as well as examining the politics behind its drafting. The continuous “battle” between State and Federal powers is illustrated by the Franklin Dam case and the process of Constitutional change through referendum is explained.

results.title: On guard
results.creator_credit: Susan Lambert, Digby Duncan and Red Heart Pictures
results.brief_description: A fast moving adventure about four women who conspire to sabotage the research program of Utero, a multinational firm engaged in reproductive engineering. They plan a midnight raid on Utero’s heavily guarded plant and as the time for the raid approaches, tensions between the four saboteurs increase.

results.title: Cricket Coaching Clinic
results.brief_description: A program in which international cricketers demonstrate the essential skills of the game. “The Cricket Coaching Clinic” is designed to instruct and motivate young and old, the uninitiated and the experienced.

results.title: Children with special abilities
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: This film explores curriculum strategies and organisational approaches which can meet the needs of children with special abilities. The school Principal, several teachers, a consultant and various children are interviewed. Two children, Emma (aged seven) and Campbell (aged ten), are featured to highlight the characteristics and learning needs of such children. Suitable for Tertiary/Teacher education.

results.title: The Singer and the Dancer
results.creator_credit: Gillian Armstrong and Australian Film Council
results.brief_description: Set in the country, an older woman relives the bitter memories of her past, through her friendship with a younger girl who is experiencing a very insecure relationship with her boyfriend. Winner of several awards including Australian Film Awards and Sydney Film Festival. Cast includes Ruth Cracknell, Elizabeth Crosby, Russell Keifel, Jude Kuring, Gerry Duggan, Julie Dawson, Jane Buckland, Kate Sheil, Rob Steele, Kerry Walker. Photographer: Russell Boyd. Based on a short story by Alan Marshall.

results.title: The Ghost in the shed
results.creator_credit: Sam Weiss, Nick Bosustow and Bosustow Entertainment
results.brief_description: A whimsical story of a polite but persistent ghost of a secretly buried murder victim. His attempts to draw attention to his remains mystify the family in the house. Based on the book by Marilynne K. Roach.

results.title: The More they learn
results.creator_credit: Daryl Mildenhall and Australian Film Commission
results.brief_description: A young man, David McPherson, discusses his experience of being paraplegic since the age of eight. The film is shot at a tertiary college where he is a residential student and he and his fellow students talk about the way he has made sure that he can fit into everyday life on campus. Discusses the problem of sexuality of the disabled. A positive film highlighting what paraplegics are capable of achieving.

results.title: Werribee: in harmony with nature
results.creator_credit: Filmpartnership and Melbourne and Metropolitan Board of Works
results.brief_description: Deals with the disposal of Melbourne’s sewage through the land sewerage scheme at Werribee farm which involves natural purification and recycling.
